events.name: Resignation of Boris Bondarev
events.wd_description: Boris Bondarev, a counselor at the Russian permanent mission to the UN in Geneva, resigned from his position, criticizing Putin's war as aggressive and based on lies.
events.description: Boris Bondarev, a counselor at the Russian permanent mission to the UN in Geneva, resigned from his position, criticizing Putin's war as aggressive and based on lies.

events.name: Bondarev's resignation
events.wd_description: Bondarev, the counselor on arms control, is the only high-level diplomat to resign from the Russian foreign ministry since the war began in February.
events.description: Bondarev, the counselor on arms control, is the only high-level diplomat to resign from the Russian foreign ministry since the war began in February.

events.name: Bondarev's criticism of the war
events.wd_description: Bondarev called the war an aggressive move by Putin driven by lies, warmongering, and hatred, and noted that other diplomats feel similarly but are unlikely to speak out.
events.description: Bondarev called the war an aggressive move by Putin driven by lies, warmongering, and hatred, and noted that other diplomats feel similarly but are unlikely to speak out.

events.name: Reactions to Bondarev's resignation
events.wd_description: Hillel Neuer, executive director of UN Watch, commended Bondarev and urged other diplomats to follow his example.
events.description: Hillel Neuer, executive director of UN Watch, commended Bondarev and urged other diplomats to follow his example.

events.name: Bondarev's future considerations
events.wd_description: When asked about returning to Russia, Bondarev indicated that it would not be a good idea right now.
events.description: When asked about returning to Russia, Bondarev indicated that it would not be a good idea right now.

events.name: Boris Johnson comments on Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_label: Boris Johnson comments on Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson commented on Russian President Vladimir Putin's slow but visible progress in the Donbas region of Eastern Ukraine, expressing concerns over the high cost to Russia.
events.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson commented on Russian President Vladimir Putin's slow but visible progress in the Donbas region of Eastern Ukraine, expressing concerns over the high cost to Russia.

events.name: Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_description: Johnson noted that Putin continues to make progress in Donbas, despite the high cost to himself and the Russian military.
events.description: Johnson noted that Putin continues to make progress in Donbas, despite the high cost to himself and the Russian military.

events.name: Invasion background
events.wd_description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine, launched on February 24, is termed a "special military operation" by Russia, but is considered a war of aggression by Ukraine and the West.
events.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine, launched on February 24, is termed a "special military operation" by Russia, but is considered a war of aggression by Ukraine and the West.

events.name: Johnson's perspective on ending the conflict
events.wd_label: Johnson's perspective on ending the conflict
events.wd_description: Johnson stated that the conflict can end only if Putin acknowledges that the denazification of Ukraine has been achieved and withdraws with dignity and honor, although he clarified he does not support the premise that there were Nazis in Ukraine.
events.description: Johnson stated that the conflict can end only if Putin acknowledges that the denazification of Ukraine has been achieved and withdraws with dignity and honor, although he clarified he does not support the premise that there were Nazis in Ukraine.

events.name: South Korea to boost defense capabilities
events.wd_label: South Korea to boost defense capabilities
events.wd_description: South Korean Defense Minister Lee Jong-sup announced plans to boost defense capabilities by working with the US and Japan to counter North Korea’s nuclear and missile threat.
events.description: South Korean Defense Minister Lee Jong-sup announced plans to boost defense capabilities by working with the US and Japan to counter North Korea’s nuclear and missile threat.

events.name: Urging North Korea to end programs
events.wd_label: Urging North Korea to end programs
events.wd_description: Lee urged North Korea to end its nuclear weapon and missile programs during an Asian security meeting in Singapore.
events.description: Lee urged North Korea to end its nuclear weapon and missile programs during an Asian security meeting in Singapore.

events.name: Strengthening defense capabilities
events.wd_description: Lee stated that South Korea will strengthen capabilities to better implement the US extended deterrence and enhance response capabilities to deter North Korea’s threats.
events.description: Lee stated that South Korea will strengthen capabilities to better implement the US extended deterrence and enhance response capabilities to deter North Korea’s threats.

events.name: Security cooperation with US and Japan
events.wd_label: Security cooperation with US and Japan
events.wd_description: Lee expressed interest in strengthening security cooperation between South Korea, the US, and Japan to respond to North Korea’s nuclear and missile programs.
events.description: Lee expressed interest in strengthening security cooperation between South Korea, the US, and Japan to respond to North Korea’s nuclear and missile programs.

events.name: Economic support for North Korea
events.wd_description: Lee mentioned that South Korea is ready to extend economic support if North Korea makes substantial progress in ending its nuclear program.
events.description: Lee mentioned that South Korea is ready to extend economic support if North Korea makes substantial progress in ending its nuclear program.

events.name: South Korean consortium invests in Indonesian EV supply chain
events.wd_label: South Korean consortium invests in Indonesian EV supply chain
events.wd_description: A South Korean consortium will invest $9bn in Indonesia to build a mines-to-manufacturing electric vehicle supply chain, aiming to reduce reliance on Chinese suppliers and mitigate commodity price rises.
events.description: A South Korean consortium will invest $9bn in Indonesia to build a mines-to-manufacturing electric vehicle supply chain, aiming to reduce reliance on Chinese suppliers and mitigate commodity price rises.

events.name: Agreement details
events.wd_description: The consortium, led by LG Energy Solution, has signed an agreement with local mining company PT Aneka Tamban (Antam) and Indonesia Battery Corporation to handle the entire battery production process.
events.description: The consortium, led by LG Energy Solution, has signed an agreement with local mining company PT Aneka Tamban (Antam) and Indonesia Battery Corporation to handle the entire battery production process.

events.name: Indonesia's nickel production
events.wd_description: Indonesia is the world's largest producer of nickel, with about 21mn tonnes of reserves according to US Geological Survey data.
events.description: Indonesia is the world's largest producer of nickel, with about 21mn tonnes of reserves according to US Geological Survey data.

events.name: Korean battery makers' investment
events.wd_description: South Korean battery makers have increased investment in EV battery chemicals and materials to reduce dependence on China, the world's biggest processor of necessary minerals.
events.description: South Korean battery makers have increased investment in EV battery chemicals and materials to reduce dependence on China, the world's biggest processor of necessary minerals.

events.name: Impact of Ukraine war
events.wd_description: The war in Ukraine has increased pressure to improve supply chain security, with Russia accounting for 11% of the world's nickel production and significant commodity price rises since the invasion.
events.description: The war in Ukraine has increased pressure to improve supply chain security, with Russia accounting for 11% of the world's nickel production and significant commodity price rises since the invasion.

events.name: Nickel price increase
events.wd_description: The London Metal Exchange's three-month nickel price has risen about 60% this year to $33,175 a tonne as of April 14, raising concern about battery makers' cost burden.
events.description: The London Metal Exchange's three-month nickel price has risen about 60% this year to $33,175 a tonne as of April 14, raising concern about battery makers' cost burden.

events.name: Auto industry's reliance on China
events.wd_description: The auto industry's transition from fossil fuel-powered vehicles is complicated by its reliance on Chinese refineries and factories, where about 80% of battery materials are processed.
events.description: The auto industry's transition from fossil fuel-powered vehicles is complicated by its reliance on Chinese refineries and factories, where about 80% of battery materials are processed.

events.name: Analyst's statement
events.wd_description: Yoon Hyuk-jin, an analyst at SK Securities, emphasized the importance of stable raw material supply for battery producers amid the Ukraine crisis, highlighting the need for upstream investments.
events.description: Yoon Hyuk-jin, an analyst at SK Securities, emphasized the importance of stable raw material supply for battery producers amid the Ukraine crisis, highlighting the need for upstream investments.

events.name: Consortium members
events.wd_description: The consortium includes LG Chem, Posco, LX International, and Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt.
events.description: The consortium includes LG Chem, Posco, LX International, and Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt.

events.name: LGES statement
events.wd_description: LGES expects the project to improve battery business capability and profitability by securing competitive raw materials in a stable manner.
events.description: LGES expects the project to improve battery business capability and profitability by securing competitive raw materials in a stable manner.

events.name: LGES and Hyundai joint venture
events.wd_description: LGES is also building a $1.1bn battery cell plant in Karawang Regency, Indonesia, as part of a joint venture with Hyundai Motor group.
events.description: LGES is also building a $1.1bn battery cell plant in Karawang Regency, Indonesia, as part of a joint venture with Hyundai Motor group.

events.name: CATL's similar project
events.wd_description: The consortium's investment was announced days after CATL signed a $6bn deal with Indonesian companies including Antam to produce a similar project.
events.description: The consortium's investment was announced days after CATL signed a $6bn deal with Indonesian companies including Antam to produce a similar project.
